doc.name: printPaperOrientation

syntax.example: set the printPaperOrientation to {"portrait" | "landscape" | "reverse portrait" | "reverse landscape"}

doc.summary: Reports the rotation of a printed page.

description.p: Use the printPaperOrientation to rotate the printed output to the desired orientation on the page.
The printPaperOrientation is one of the following values.
The default value is determined by the default settings of the current printer.
Attempting to set the printPaperOrientation to an invalid value will result in a script execution error.
To have an effect, this property must be set before calling open printing.
Cross-platform note: The reverse options are not supported on Windows. When used Windows will revert these options to their non-reverse counterparts.
